page.title: 03HEALTH SERVICES: NETHERBURY
page.content: The area is high, hilly and healthy and the community is served mainly by Beaminster's 4 G.Ps. who, together with the community team, provide many of the services which in an urban area would be available only in a large hospital. Bridport, four miles distant, has a 24 bed general hospital with casualty unit and there are two large district hospitals within 20 miles. Home delivery of babies is now an untoward event, nearly all being born in local maternity units. Perinatal mortality for West Dorset is 0.54% Senior citizens are generally in reasonable to good health. Both Beaminster and Netherbury have warden-controlled apartments or homes for the elderly and Bridport provides both private and local authority establishments. New complexes are under construction locally.
